title: AI-Generated Song Detection via Lyrics Transcripts
author: Markus Frohmann (Deezer Research), Elena V. Epure (Deezer Research), Gabriel Meseguer-Brocal (Deezer Research), Markus Schedl (Johannes Kepler University Linz), Romain Hennequin (Linz Institute of Technology, AI Lab), ...
relevance_why: The methods for analyzing lyrics and transcribing audio could enhance Haohe Liu's work in audio generation and detection by applying similar lyrical analysis techniques to audio signals.
background: Detecting whether a song is generated by artificial intelligence based on lyrics transcribed from audio, rather than relying on perfect lyrics metadata.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel approach for AI-generated music detection by leveraging transcribed lyrics, achieving robust performance across multiple genres and languages.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods for detecting AI-generated music primarily relied on audio analysis, which struggled with generalization and sensitivity to audio manipulations.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves on past approaches by using automatic speech recognition to capture lyrical content from audio, leading to enhanced detection robustness.

key_innovation: Utilizes automatic speech recognition to extract lyrics from audio, enabling the application of proven text-based detection methods to classify AI-generated content.
real_world_impact: This research addresses copyright concerns in the music industry by providing a reliable detection method for AI-generated content, which is increasingly prevalent in music catalogs.
limitations: No explicit mention of limitations regarding transcription accuracy or dependency on the quality of ASR models.

new_terms.automatic speech recognition: **Automatic Speech Recognition (ASR)** refers to the technology that enables computers to convert spoken language into text.
